abstract: As Wells Fargo and Citigroup haggle over who will get to acquire Wachovia, many news reports are pointing out that Wells Fargo’s $15 billion offer for Wachovia doesn’t require government assistance. By contrast, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation is backstopping some of the potential losses in Citi’s $2 billion deal.
lead_paragraph: As Wells Fargo and Citigroup haggle over who will get to acquire Wachovia, many news reports are pointing out that Wells Fargo’s $15 billion offer for Wachovia doesn’t require government assistance. By contrast, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation is backstopping some of the potential losses in Citi’s $2 billion deal.

headline.main: Bank Deals Get Help From the I.R.S.
